primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God sends a transformative figure (Elijah/Jesus) to intrude upon a dying world to restore life, abundance, and reconciliation.

subject.identificatie: God (as the Sender/Initiator) and Elijah/Jesus (as the Agent/Subject of action).
tekstueel_bewijs: He [Elijah] upset everything, healed things, made a difference
He [Jesus] came to make a difference. He came to bring life to a world of death.

object.identificatie: Newness, restoration of life, and the reconciliation of the human family.
tekstueel_bewijs: to turn the hearts of parents to their children
rooted in God’s promise just at the edge of Matthew

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'little ones', the widow, the 'hopeless' world, and the current congregation.
tekstueel_bewijs: the ones who took all the land from the little people
we are the ones who know he will come
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver/Beneficiary of the 'intrusive' action.

helper.identificatie: Ancient miracles, the memory of Israel, and the Sacramental meal.
tekstueel_bewijs: That is why we eat and drink this meal
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject/Sender; the Spirit is implied in the 'spirit and power of Elijah'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Consumerism, phoney religion, greed, death, and the 'cynics'.
tekstueel_bewijs: greedy systems that abuse the little ones
contemporary cynics do not believe it
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but systemic 'deathliness' and 'hopelessness' that requires a divine intrusion.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The community 'pauses' and 'makes space' for the coming one during Advent.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church/Hearers
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Space for the absent one / Hope
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (waiting/pausing) is a response to the divine promise of coming.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: Pause in the frenzy to make space

voorbeelden: they would have to pay for it in big ways
what we most want and need
you cannot understand what time it is, unless you know about Elijah
He will be back to finish what he started

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of the divine agent to do what humans cannot (bring life from death).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Intrusion' of the Subject (Elijah/Jesus) who breaks the cycle of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death and greed are presented as insurmountable without divine intervention.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God and His agent (Elijah/Jesus) are the primary actants. The human role is reduced to waiting, remembering, and receiving.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Pause in the frenzy to make space

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is making new, doing something in our presence

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Elijah is not an example to follow, but a 'carrier of hope' and a precursor to the divine action in Jesus.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Elijah is the 'intrusive power' of God, not a moral hero for us to imitate.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and expectant hope; moving from anxiety to 'waiting'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic: salvation and renewal are entirely the work of the 'Absent One' who becomes present.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Old Testament Elijah to the New Testament Jesus is structurally seamless through the actantial role of 'The One who Intrudes'.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'rational' world and the 'irrational' hope of the believer.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He defeated the phoniness... he showed how the God of the Bible would give life.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'spirit and power of Elijah' is a gift that enables the turning of hearts.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'deathliness', 'greed', and 'exploitation'—a state of being 'sick to death'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Elijah/Jesus as the Subject of all transformative action. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the Advent theme of divine intervention.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (death/consumerism) is already sufficiently formidable.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's intrusion) clearly precedes and enables the secondary program (reconciliation).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that avoids the trap of turning biblical figures into moral examples, focusing instead on the continuity of God's intrusive grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'frenzy' vs 'pause' imagery, Greimas reveals that the 'pause' is not the cause of the miracle, but the actantial reception of it.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical Malachi; semiotics shows how the 'Elijah-function' operates across both testaments as a single actant.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas helps identify that the 'Absent One' is actually the most active Subject in the narrative, despite the title's suggestion of absence.

volledige_subject_lijst: Elijah (upset, healed, created, prayed, confronted, thundered)
appendices.notities: The sermon avoids 'imperative creep' by framing the human response as 'remembering' and 'pausing' rather than 'achieving'.
